User provide high-level research directi.Format: User provides a target research paper or topic as the seed for idea generation.
User provide high-level research directi.Example: Input paper from top conferences (e.g., ACL, ICLR, CVPR) is provided to the system.
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Defines the starting point and focus for the automated idea generation process.

User provide research papers.Format: Full text, title, abstract, and references of research papers.
User provide research papers.Example: 170 seed papers from top conferences are used as input for idea generation.
User provide research papers.Role in workflow: Serve as the primary evidence base and context for LLM-driven idea generation.

Query Decomposition.Method details: LLMs are prompted to analyze the target paper and its references, identifying tasks, methods, innovations, and limitations before proposing new ideas.
Query Decomposition.Outputs: Structured analysis (tasks, methods, limitations) and a set of new research ideas.
Query Decomposition.Example: Prompt asks LLM to answer: What are the tasks, methods, and main innovations? What are the weaknesses and limitations?
Query Decomposition.Role in workflow: Breaks down the research context to guide focused idea generation.

Workflow Decomposition.Method details: LLMs decompose the research idea into submodules for detailed proposal development.
Workflow Decomposition.Outputs: List of submodules with specific content, purpose, and keywords.
Workflow Decomposition.Example: Method decomposition step in proposal generation (e.g., breaking down 'Adaptive Ethical Dialogue System' into modules).
Workflow Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables detailed, stepwise design of research proposals.

Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Method details: Embeddings (e.g., all-MiniLM-L6-v2) are used for novelty and diversity measurement by computing similarity between generated ideas and existing literature.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Inputs: Generated ideas and top-10 most relevant papers.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Outputs: Cosine similarity scores for novelty/diversity assessment.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Example: Cosine similarity threshold >0.3 for novelty, >0.8 for duplication.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Role in workflow: Supports semantic comparison for novelty/diversity evaluation.

Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Method details: LLMs generate search plans to identify which fields and keywords to use for retrieving relevant papers in each iteration.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Outputs: Search queries and plans for literature retrieval.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Example: LLM plans which areas to search for new knowledge to enhance novelty/diversity.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Role in workflow: Expands the scope of literature exploration iteratively.

Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Method details: Retrieval of papers using APIs such as Semantic Scholar; also tracks recent influential papers via social media, forums, and GitHub.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Outputs: Relevant papers and summaries of research trends.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Example: Iterative retrieval of topic-relevant papers through Semantic Scholar API.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Role in workflow: Provides up-to-date external knowledge for idea generation.

Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Method details: LLMs use self-reflection to select the most promising ideas from those generated in each iteration.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Outputs: Filtered set of top ideas (e.g., 3 per iteration).
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Example: Generate 10 new ideas, then use self-reflection to select 3.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Role in workflow: Ensures only the most novel/diverse ideas are retained.

Literature data Retrieval Citation-Netwo.Method details: References of the input paper are used to expand the knowledge base for idea generation.
Literature data Retrieval Citation-Netwo.Outputs: Set of related papers for context.
Literature data Retrieval Citation-Netwo.Example: Seed idea generation uses both the target paper and its references.
Literature data Retrieval Citation-Netwo.Role in workflow: Grounds idea generation in the broader citation network.

Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Method details: Embeddings are used to retrieve the top-10 most relevant papers for novelty/diversity checks.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Outputs: List of similar papers for comparison.

Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Method details: Retrieval is guided by domain-specific keywords and trending topics identified from recent high-quality papers.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Inputs: Research trending info, high-quality paper list.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Example: LLM analyzes trending topics to guide retrieval.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Role in workflow: Ensures relevance to current research frontiers.

Manual and Semi-Automatic Curation of Li.Method details: Manual selection of 170 high-quality seed papers from top conferences and user-rated sources.
Manual and Semi-Automatic Curation of Li.Example: Filtering by citation count and user engagement.

Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Method details: LLMs are prompted to extract tasks, methods, innovations, and limitations from papers.
Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Example: Prompt step: 'What are the tasks, methods, and main innovations?'

Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Method details: LLMs generate summaries of research trends and extract knowledge from recent papers.

Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Role in workflow: Provides concise context for idea generation.

Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Method details: LLMs extract specific facets such as problem, motivation, method, and experiment plan for proposal generation.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Example: Initial proposal template includes problem, existing methods, motivation, method, experiment plan.

Task/Entity-Centric Knowledge Graphs.Method details: Baseline (Research-Agent) uses external knowledge graphs for co-occurrence entity search.
Task/Entity-Centric Knowledge Graphs.Example: Research-Agent integrates retrieved entities into LLM prompts.
Task/Entity-Centric Knowledge Graphs.Role in workflow: Supports structured idea generation in baseline comparison.

Literature Database Construction.Method details: Curated a dataset of 170 high-quality papers, segmented for use in idea generation and evaluation.
Literature Database Construction.Example: Filtering by citation and user engagement.
Literature Database Construction.Role in workflow: Provides a structured corpus for retrieval and benchmarking.

Entity- or Co-Occurrence–Based Databases.Method details: Baseline (Research-Agent) builds knowledge graphs based on entity co-occurrence.
Entity- or Co-Occurrence–Based Databases.Example: Knowledge graph construction for baseline agent.

Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Method details: LLMs use internal knowledge to generate initial seed ideas, including self-check, self-critique, and reflection.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Example: Prompted to generate ideas based on shortcomings of the input paper.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Role in workflow: Kickstarts the ideation process with diverse, novel ideas.

LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Method details: LLMs decompose research ideas into submodules for detailed proposal development.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Outputs: List of submodules for further design.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Example: Method decomposition step in proposal generation.

Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Method details: LLMs generate ideas using both the target paper and its references, as well as retrieved external papers.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Example: Prompt combines target and referenced papers to propose new ideas.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Role in workflow: Grounds idea generation in existing literature.

Summarization Literature data used durin.Method details: LLMs use summaries of research trends and recent papers to inspire new ideas.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Example: LLM distills research trends for idea inspiration.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Role in workflow: Aligns ideas with current research directions.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Method details: LLMs use scientific discovery methods (e.g., Kuhn’s paradigm, anomaly analysis) to recombine facets and generate new problems.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Example: Prompt uses 10 scientific discovery methods to guide ideation.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Role in workflow: Promotes diversity and novelty in idea generation.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Knowledge.Method details: Baseline (Research-Agent) uses knowledge graphs for entity-based idea generation.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Knowledge.Role in workflow: Supports structured, entity-driven ideation in baseline.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: LLMs (e.g., Claude-3.5-Sonnet) perform pairwise comparisons of ideas for quality using the Swiss Tournament system.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Swiss Tournament with 5 rounds of pairwise comparison per idea.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Ranks ideas by overall quality for selection.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Method details: LLMs check if generated ideas are novel by comparing them to the top-10 most relevant papers using embedding similarity.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Method details: Panel of 10 experts (PhDs/professors) evaluate ideas for novelty and quality, ranking best/worst ideas.

Experimental Design Generation via liter.Method details: LLMs generate experiment plans by referencing existing benchmarks, datasets, and evaluation metrics from literature.

Experimental Design Generation via Liter.Method details: LLMs synthesize methods and experiment plans by integrating context from target and referenced papers.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: LLMs iteratively plan and search for new knowledge, refining experiment plans and proposals at each step.

Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Method details: LLMs use self-reflection and critique to iteratively refine ideas and proposals after each planning/search iteration.
